metadata.title: CVE-2014-7185 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in bufferobject.c in Python before 2.7.8 allowscontext-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information from processmemory via a large size and offset in a "buffer" function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.2').
